topic.title: How to Add a Draft Watermark Depending on Metadata

body.p: Suppose you want to apply a Draft watermark until your DITA bookmap is approved and the map is approved when an approved element has been added to the metadata section (for example, in the bookmeta/bookchangehistory element).

Use oxy_xpath every time you need to probe the value from an element other than the one matched by the CSS selector, and test the expression on the merged HTML file using the Oxygen XPath Builder view.
You can either use a page selector that imposes the draft watermark on the entire page surface (recommended):
or use an element selector that restricts the watermark image only to the page area covered by that element:
body.note: You can use another element selector to target a specific part of your publication (for example, marking only the tables as drafts).
